intro: Borreria squamosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf borreria, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, often glandular leaves. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Borreria squamosa is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
